content:
I will now generate an optimization hypothesis to improve the stepwise yield.
My reasoning for using the `Hypothesis` tool is to get advice on how to optimize the current experimental procedure to reach the desired state-of-the-art stepwise yield.

I am filling in the `current_optimize_target` parameter with "stepwise yield" because the primary goal at this stage is to improve the yield.
I am filling in the `current_procedure_id` parameter with "Protocol-aceb" because this is the ID of the most recent procedure that was executed, and it serves as the base for the next optimization attempt.
I am filling in the `manuals` parameter with `["beads-manual", "3-ONH2-dnTP-manual"]` as these are the relevant manuals that were identified earlier in the process and might contain information useful for generating an optimization hypothesis.
I am filling in the `roll_back_num` parameter with `0` because the last optimization attempt resulted in an improvement (from 94.07% to 95.72%), so we do not need to roll back any previous changes.

args.experiment_name: enzymatic de novo DNA synthesis of ACTCTGAT
